org.ingatan.component.text
Class RichTextArea

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.text.JTextComponent
                  javax.swing.JEditorPane
                      javax.swing.JTextPane
                          org.ingatan.component.text.RichTextArea
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable
public class RichTextArea
extends javax.swing.JTextPane

An extension of the JTextPane, the rich text area includes an instance of RichTextToolbar, which allows for easy formatting. It also sets a keymap of standard formatting hot keys such as Ctrl+B for bold, Crtl+U for underline, etc.

This class implements undo/redo listening, and maps the undo/redo keys to Ctrl+z and Ctrl+Shift+z respectively. It also implements the SymbolMenu for easy insertion of non standard keyboard characters.
The toolbar buttons have all been implemented apart from the insert picture button. You can implement your own insert picture routine, following your particular needs, by using a RichTextToolbarListener and listening for e.getEventID == RichTextToolbarEvent.INSERT_PICTURE. This listener can be added to the RichTextArea's toolbar using richTextArea.getToolbar().addRichTextToolbarListener()
When adding this class to a container, you will need to user container.add(richTextArea.getScroller()) if you want the toolbar and scroll pane. Otherwise, just add it as usual.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Thomas Everingham
See Also:
Serialized Form

TAG_FONT_COLOUR

public static final java.lang.String TAG_FONT_COLOUR
Tag used for specifying font colour. The usage is as follows:
[TAG_FONT_COLOUR]red,green,blue[!TAG_FONT_COLOUR]
where red, green and blue are the integer values specifying the colour.

Constructor Detail

RichTextArea

public RichTextArea(int toolbarLayout)
Creates a new RichTextArea instance with the specified toolbar layout.

Parameters:
toolbarLayout - either horizontal or vertical - use the fields in the RichTextToolbar class.

RichTextArea

public RichTextArea()
Creates a new RichTextArea with horizontal toolbar layout.

Method Detail

setRichText

public void setRichText(java.lang.String rawText)
This method parses the raw text string that is passed to it and generates the formatted text. If answer field tags are encountered, then the corresponding classes will be instantiated and added to the text field. If image tags are encountered, the corresponding resources will be added to the text field. This method will overwrite any existing content within the text field.

Parameters:
rawText - the text to parse into the field.

getRichText

public java.lang.String getRichText()
Encodes the current text, formatting and contained answer fields/images to a single String. This string can then be used to reconstruct the content of the text field through use of the setRichText method. A HTML-like markup is used with special tags for answer fields and images.

Returns:
a string containing the markup description of the text field content including any answer fields and images that may be contained by it, and all rich text formatting.

getRichText

public java.lang.String getRichText(int startIndex,
                                    int endIndex)
Encodes the text that exists between startIndex and endIndex with formatting and contained answer fields/images to a single String. This string can then be used to reconstruct the content of the text field through use of the setRichText method. A HTML-like markup is used with special tags for answer fields and images.

Parameters:
endIndex - the end index of the text to encode.
startIndex - the start index of the text to encode.
Returns:
a string containing the markup description of the text field content specified including any answer fields and images that may be contained by it, and all rich text formatting.

insertRichText

public void insertRichText(java.lang.String rawText)
This method parses the raw text string that is passed to it and generates the formatted text. If answer field tags are encountered, then the corresponding classes will be instantiated and added to the text field. If image tags are encountered, the corresponding resources will be added to the text field. This method inserts the resulting rich text at the current caret position of the RichTextArea. If there is a selection, it will be replaced by the parsed rich text.

Parameters:
rawText - the text to parse into the field.

getRunElementText

protected java.lang.String getRunElementText(javax.swing.text.Element e)
                                      throws javax.swing.text.BadLocationException
Gets the text from an element within a document.

Parameters:
e - the element from which to get the text.
Returns:
the text from the document corresponding to this element.
Throws:
javax.swing.text.BadLocationException - if the start and end indices given by the element are invalid locations within the document.

setUpKeyMap

public void setUpKeyMap()
Sets up the relationship between keystrokes and formatting actions.

getScroller

public javax.swing.JScrollPane getScroller()
Returns the JScrollPane which holds this RichTextArea instance. This allows external classes to add the scroll pane, rather than the text area itself.

Returns:
the JScrollPane which holds this RichTextArea instance.

getToolbar

public RichTextToolbar getToolbar()
Gets the toolbar associated with this RichTextToolbar.

Returns:
the toolbar associated with this RichTextToolbar.

setToolbarVisible

public void setToolbarVisible(boolean isVisible)
Set whether or not the toolbar is visible.

Parameters:
isVisible - whether or not the toolbar is visible.

isToolbarVisible

public boolean isToolbarVisible()
Gets whether or not the toolbar is currently visible.

Returns:
whether or not the toolbar is currently visible.

getSymbolMenuActivateKey

public javax.swing.KeyStroke getSymbolMenuActivateKey()
Get the current key associated with telling the menu that the next character to be typed is the new base character. Supports modifiers.

Returns:
the current menu activate key.

getSymbolMenu

public SymbolMenu getSymbolMenu()
Get the SymbolMenu instance associated with this component. This allows you to set the colours of the component.

Returns:
the SymbolMenu instance associated with this component.

setSymbolMenuActivateKey

public void setSymbolMenuActivateKey(javax.swing.KeyStroke symbolMenuActivateKey)
Sets the menu activate key. This is the key that tells the SymbolMenu instance that the next key to be pressed is the new base character. Supports modifiers.

Parameters:
symbolMenuActivateKey - the new menu activate key.

setToolbarToggles

public void setToolbarToggles(int position)
As the user moves the caret or specifies new formatting, the toolbar must indicate the formatting under the current caret position. This method set this information to the toolbar.

Parameters:
position - the current position of the caret.
